name: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Up to date, and specific to this contract
TESTING & INSPECTION METHODOLOGY - Submitted to Client Health and Safety Representative
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - SSSP and SWMS produced and submitted

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - CMP submitted before commencing work, to be approved by Engineer

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - QA system needs to store test requirements in a manner that can be reasonably found on-demand

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - CMP submitted before commencing work, to be approved by Engineer

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - As-Builts to be supplied to the engineer prior to practical completion or on request
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Photos and survey prior to further works
TESTING & INSPECTION METHODOLOGY - Contractor to identify and select suitable material for fill. Quality records made available to the engineer.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Fill material approved by the Engineer
TESTING & INSPECTION METHODOLOGY - Compact fill material to 95% of MDD
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Fill material approved by the Engineer and compacted to 95% of MDD and 2% off OMC
TESTING & INSPECTION METHODOLOGY - Respread topsoil to Design FL
TESTING & INSPECTION METHODOLOGY - Inspect trench base prior to pipe installation
SPECIFICATION REFERENCE - CCC CSS Part 3, Section 6.4
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Ensure there are no soft spots or organic matter on and/or in the subgrade and depths are in accordance with design
TESTING & INSPECTION METHODOLOGY - NDM testing each 400mm layer at 15m intervals
SPECIFICATION REFERENCE - CCC CSS Part 1, Section 32
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Approved backfill material only compacted to 95% of MDD at 15m intervals with a minimum dry density of 2150kg/m³
TESTING & INSPECTION METHODOLOGY - Corbel inspections (Pre construction and Post construction)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Ensure compliance with Local Council
TESTING & INSPECTION METHODOLOGY - Air Pressuse testing (Pipes less the or equal to 450mm dia
SPECIFICATION REFERENCE - CCC CSS Part 3, Section 14
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Pipe section is to be pumped to 10 kPa which is to be maintained for at least 3 minutes
SPECIFICATION REFERENCE - CCC CSS Part 3, Section 14
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - General pipe cleanliness and ensure there is no sudden changes in alignment, leaking or potential areas prone to leaking (open joins), pipe cracking or obstructions/debris
TESTING & INSPECTION METHODOLOGY - Drainage Checklist to be completed of every pipe line
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Completed by Foreman for every line installed, before starting a new line
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - As-Builts to be supplied to the engineer prior to practical completion or on request
TESTING & INSPECTION METHODOLOGY - Clean AP40 to be used
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Complies with relevant material spec
TESTING & INSPECTION METHODOLOGY - Clegg hammer testing at 15m intervals
SPECIFICATION REFERENCE - CCC CSS Part 6, Section 6.6
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - CLEGG test shall exceed a CIV of 25 (Residential)
○ CLEGG test shall exceed a CIV of 35 (Commercial)
RECORD - Engineer inspection, CLEGG Test Records
TESTING & INSPECTION METHODOLOGY - Subgrade inspection prior to placing sub-base
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - There is little to no moisture on the surface, no soft spots or organic matter on and/or in the subgrade and depths are in accrodance with design.
TESTING & INSPECTION METHODOLOGY - Clean AP65 to be used
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Complies with relevant material spec
TESTING & INSPECTION METHODOLOGY - Compact all fill materials to 95% of MDD

TESTING & INSPECTION METHODOLOGY - Compact all fill materials to 98% of MDD
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Fill material approved by the Engineer and compacted to 95% of MDD and 2% off OMC.
○ Test every 10m alternating between LHS and RHS

TESTING & INSPECTION METHODOLOGY - Benkleman Beam testing after basecourse compaction and prior to sealing
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - 95% of test must be less than specified requirements
TESTING & INSPECTION METHODOLOGY - Engineer inspections prior to sealing
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - ensure a moziac basecourse finish has been achieved and there is no pooling/high levels of moisture in the surface.
TESTING & INSPECTION METHODOLOGY - NDM testing every 10m
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - All ND readings shall not be less than 2150kg/m3
TESTING & INSPECTION METHODOLOGY - Check alignment, grade, Cutdowns, SW outlets prior to pouring
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - All checks completed prior to commencement of kerb pour
TESTING & INSPECTION METHODOLOGY - 28 Days after kerb pour, 1 kerb core is to be taken for each pour
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - 90mm dia concrete core 28 day strength is to be greater than 20Mpa

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Ensure there are no soft spots or organic matter on and/or in the subgrade and depths are in accordance with design

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - EF welding equipment to pass weld testing criteria on specified materials prior to use on site
